availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Cumming Schenck (U.S. Army general, attorney, politician, and diplomat)

body.p: Dayton, Ohio, attorney, politician, diplomat, and soldier. Franklin, Ohio, native. Son of William Cortenus Schenck. Married Rennelke Smith Schenck at Missequoque, Long Island, New York, on August 21, 1834. Father of Elizabeth R. Schenck, Julia C. Schenck, and Sallie S. Schenck. Graduated from Miami University in Oxford, Ohio, with a Bachelor of Arts in 1827. Read law with Thomas Corwin. Professor at Miami University from 1827 to 1829. Admitted to the Ohio bar in January 1833. Member of Ohio House of Representatives from 1839 to 1843. Successful Whig candidate to the U.S. House of Representatives from March 4, 1843 to March 3, 1851. Attorney in Dayton, Ohio, in 1850. U.S. envoy and minister to Brazil from March 12, 1851, to October 8, 1853. Attorney in Dayton, Ohio, in 1860. Served as brigadier general of Volunteers (U.S.A.) from May 17, 1861, to August 30, 1862. Major general from August 30, 1862, to December 5, 1863. Member of the U.S. House of Representatives from March 4, 1863, to January 5, 1871.
